title: Technology Carbon Standard
description: The Technology Carbon Standard is a standard for measuring and managing the carbon emissions of technology products and services.

reportingPeriod.description: The reporting period for the carbon emissions data.

fromDate.description: Reporting start date in ISO8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)

toDate.description: Reporting end date in ISO8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD)

upstream_emissions.description: Upstream emissions relating to the embodied carbon of hardware and the development of software.

software.description: Emissions associated with developing and delivering off-the-shelf and open-source software installed on the organisation's systems.

employee_hardware.description: Embodied carbon emissions associated with hardware devices owned by an organisation, including emissions from the manufacture, transportation, installation, maintenance, and end-of-life of a device.

network_hardware.description: When considering the upstream emissions of a network, consider the embodied carbon of any networking devices that are owned by the organisation.

server_hardware.description: Servers, storage systems, and data centre infrastructure installed on-premise.

direct_emissions.description: Direct running costs that are attributed to the electricity powering servers, networks and devices.

onsite_employee_hardware.description: Emissions associated with the operation and use of devices owned by an organisation.

networking.description: Emissions associated with the operation and use of networking and infrastructure.

servers.description: The energy consumed by on-premise servers and data centres.

generators.description: Any fossil fuel-powered generators, solar PV, wind turbines, or other systems installed on-site to supply electricity to technology equipment.

indirect_emissions.description: Indirect running carbon costs that are attributed to external hardware and service solutions.

offsite_employee_hardware.description: The emissions incurred by computers (desktops, laptops), monitors, printers, and other devices used by employees, when used out-of-office.

cloud_services.description: The emissions associated with cloud platform services like compute, storage, and networking.

saas.description: The emissions associated with Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) applications.

managed_services.description: The associated emissions of Managed Security Operations, IT support and data backup services.

downstream_emissions.description: Carbon associated with the use of products and services produced by the organisation.

end_user_devices.description: This considers the emissions generated from the electricity consumption of devices such as desktops, laptops, tablets, and mobile phones that utilise the products or services provided by an organisation.

network_data_transfer.description: These emissions are associated with the infrastructure enabling data transmission, enabling end-users to access the products and services.
